thread.title: C-M’s Hostetter wins, L-S girls finish second at Montezuma
thread.title_full: C-M’s Hostetter wins, L-S girls finish second at Montezuma

title: C-M’s Hostetter wins, L-S girls finish second at Montezuma
text:
C-M’s Hostetter wins, L-S girls finish second at Montezuma Published: Friday, Oct. 9, 2015 11:38 a.m. CDT • Updated: Friday, Oct. 9, 2015 12:23 p.m. CDT Caption (Troy Hyde/Daily News) Lynnville-Sully’s Ida Byggeth runs in the Saydel Invitational earlier this season. Byggeth was third in Montezuma on Thursday and the Hawks finished second as a team. By Troy Hyde Newton Daily News 
MONTEZUMA — Colfax-Mingo junior Dakota Hostetter is still working her way back from an ankle injury that sidelined her for a few meets. Thursday’s effort was a step in the right direction. 
Hostetter was the overall winner of the Montezuma Cross Country Invitational as she edged South Tama County senior Isabelle Tyynismaa by a little more than a second. 
Hostetter crossed in 22 minutes, 53.56 seconds and her younger sister was 22nd overall as the Tigerhawks placed fifth in the team race with 136 points. 
Lynnville-Sully had three finishers in the top 13 and that pushed the Hawks to second overall with 66 points. South Tama won the meet with 49 points. 
Lynnville-Sully was led by Ida Byggeth and Marissa Vos, who both medaled in third and fourth, respectively. Byggeth crossed in 23:57.67 and Vos hit the line in 24:05.53. The rest of the scorers for the Hawks included Kasiah Ehresman in 13th, Haley James in 23rd and Hailey Scandridge in 25th. Kristine Jaennette and Rebecca Morningstar also ran, finishing 34th and 45th, respectively. The top 20 finishers earned a medal. 
After the Hostetter sisters for the Tigerhawks was Payton Rhone in 38th. Kylie Wellington also finished 47th and Morgan McKinney crossed the line in 53rd. Colleen Craig did not participate. 
Both Lynnville-Sully and Colfax-Mingo will run in the South Iowa Cedar League meet at 4:30 p.m. Thursday in Sigourney.
